newsitem.title: INDIA: India GAIL 96/97 LPG output 610,520 tonnes.
newsitem.headline: India GAIL 96/97 LPG output 610,520 tonnes.

text.p: State-run Gas Authority of India Ltd (GAIL) said on Tuesday its liquified petroleum gas (LPG) output increased to 610,520 tonnes in 1996/97 (April-March) from 549,563 in 1995/96.
GAIL said in a statement its LPG plants, under construction at Lakwa in the northeastern state of Assam and Usar in the western state of Maharashtra, would be completed in 1998.
The company is awaiting government clearance for a proposed gas processing complex in the western state of Gujarat and the LPG plant at Aurayia in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh.
"With these plants GAIL hopes to establish a capacity of about 1.25 million tonnes of LPG in 1998/1999," the statement said.
